title.string: WHAT INFORMATION MAY WE COLLECT FROM OUR USERS?

content.string:
There are two main methods we use:
  1. Use of the Services. We collect Non-Personal and Personal Information when you register with, access or use the Service. In other words, we are aware of your usage of the Service and may gather, collect and record the information relating to such usage. We also collect Non-Personal and Personal Information derived from information we receive from third party services and providers we work with.
  2. Voluntarily Provided. We may collect Personal Information which you voluntarily provide to us when you use the Service. We may also collect information provided via your social network account(s) in the event that you voluntarily choose to share it with us (like Facebook), through , your use of the mobile application,  and may also collect Non-Personal Information through the processing, analysis and anonymization of Personal Information provided by you.

title.string: HOW DO WE COLLECT INFORMATION ON OUR USERS?

content.string:
We take great care in implementing and maintaining the security of the Service and our Users’ Personal Information. We employ industry standard procedures and policies to ensure the safety of our Users’ Personal Information, reduce the risks stemming from loss of information and prevent unauthorized use of any such information. However, we do not and cannot guarantee that unauthorized access will never occur and reiterate that no measure can provide absolute information security.
You can choose the information you share with other STW Users (in your community). If you choose a username which can easily identify you, or voluntarily share information, which may identify you, consequently your Personal Information, which you have chosen to share on your account, including Special Categories of Personal Data, can then be identified as your data. Therefore, prior to posting any information that may identify you, you should carefully consider whether you wish to be identifiable on the Site and/or App, and whether you want to post information that may be capable of being connected to you. Once you do, and you also make Special Categories of Data about yourself available, you will be deemed as having made that data public.

We retain the Personal Information we collect only for as long as your registered user account exists in our system and as needed in order to provide you with our services and to comply with applicable laws and regulations.
If you withdraw your consent to us processing your Personal Information, we will delete your Personal Information from our systems (except to the extent such data in whole or in part is required to comply with any applicable rule or regulation and/or to respond to or defend against legal proceedings brought against us or our affiliates).

If the law applicable to you grants you such rights, you may ask to access, correct, or delete your Personal Information that is stored in our systems. You may also ask for our confirmation as to whether or not we process your Personal Information. Under certain circumstances, you may have the right to restrict processing and/or object to the processing of your Personal Information. Subject to the limitations in law, you may request that we update, correct, or delete inaccurate or outdated information. You may also request that we suspend the use of any Personal Information whose accuracy you contest while we verify the status of that data. Subject to the limitations in law, you may also be entitled to obtain the Personal Information you directly provided us (excluding Information we obtained from other sources) in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format and may have the right to transmit such Information to another party. If you wish to exercise any of these rights, contact us with an explicit request at: support@stuffthatworks.health. When handling these requests, we may ask for additional information to confirm your identity and your request. Please note, upon request to delete your Personal Information, we may retain such Information in whole or in part to comply with any applicable rule or regulation and/or to respond to or defend against legal proceedings brought against us or our affiliates. To find out whether these rights apply to you and for any other privacy-related matters, you can contact your local Information protection authority if you have concerns regarding your rights under local law.

title.string: WHAT IS THE LEGAL BASIS FOR USE?

content.string:
We may use information that we collect about you for the following purposes:
  • To provide, operate and improve our Service to you such as through features such as data analytics and manage our business;
  • To develop new services and features for our Users;
  • To find and analyze the correlations between different groups of patients and treatments;
  • To personalize our service to you by generating insights for our Users and connecting patients with similar conditions so that they may share their treatment histories and experiences, including by way of creating Reports for our Users, ensuring a better User experience;
  • To provide and personalize our service to you, including by creating our Mapping Feature, allowing our Users who have shared their Report with the relevant community to receive insights regarding their positioning within their relevant condition community and possible interplay between certain chronic conditions they may have and additional conditions.
  • To provide and personalize our service to you, including by creating our Condition Resemblance Feature, allowing our Users who have shared their Report with us, to receive information regarding possible similarities between their symptoms and the symptoms and/or conditions or other Users who have shared their Reports with us.
  • To send you updates, notices, notifications, announcements, and additional information related to the Service;
  • To be able to manage your account and provide you with customer support;
  • To display or send to you marketing and advertising material and general and personalized content and advertisements via the Service, email, postal mail, telephone and/or mobile devices;
  • To develop, display, and track content and advertising tailored to your interests on our Service and other sites, including providing our advertisements to you when you visit other sites;
  • To create cumulative statistical data and other cumulative information and/or other conclusive information that is non-personal, in which we and/or our business partners might make use of in order to operate and improve our Service and provide related services;
  • To perform market research using deidentified and/or aggregated data.
  • To perform and provide scientific and medical research, and improve treatment options for patients, using deidentified and/or aggregated data. With your consent, we may share your information with our Partners in the industry, government and/or academia for research purposes, as more fully described below.
  • To perform functions or services as otherwise described to you at the time of collection;
  • To prevent, detect, mitigate, and investigate fraud, security breaches or other potentially prohibited or illegal activities;
  • To comply with any applicable rule or regulation and/or respond to or defend against legal proceedings brought against us or our affiliates.

title.string: WHAT ARE THE PURPOSES OF THE COLLECTION OF INFORMATION?

content.string:
• The STW Community: Through your use of the Service, when you register as a member you may choose to share various data and information, including your name, STW profile photo or avatar, or possibly other Personal Information, with other registered members with the same condition(s), or with the broader STW community at large, as provided in the TOU for instance, when you choose to share your Reports with the relevant STW community, such Reports will be reflected in the chronic condition map and insights derived from such map shall be visible to other Users from your community who also elected to share their Reports. Sharing your information and experiences with other registred members is a way to add value to the community experience and makes the Service beneficial for everyone involved, and it will always be done with your explicit consent. Only those registered members in your community with reciprocal share settings will have access to your Report, all at your discretion.
  • Third Party Services: We are partnering with a number of selected service providers, whose services and solutions complement, facilitate and enhance our own. These include hosting, database and server co-location services (e.g. Amazon (AWS)), data analytics services (Google Analytics, Google Optimize, Mixpanel), e-mail and text message distribution and monitoring services (SendGrid), session replay records for analytic purposes such as crashes, functionality and usability (e.g. TrackJS) and our business, legal and financial advisors (collectively, “Third Party Service Providers”).
  • Such Third-Party Service Providers may receive or otherwise have access to your Personal Information, depending on each of their particular roles and purposes in facilitating and enhancing the Service, and may only use your Personal Information for such purposes. Such disclosure or access is strictly subject to the recipient's or user's undertaking of confidentiality obligations, and the prevention of any independent right to use this data except as required to help us provide the Service
  • Our Partners. We will not share your personal information without your explicit consent, with our valued partners, including but not limited to those in the medical, pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries, academic institutions, and government agencies and regulatory bodies, including regulatory bodies such as the American CDC and FDA, or other national and international bodies, as applicable and as necessary. We may share only de-identified and/or aggregated information with Partners, in order to conduct scientific, and/or medical research, as part of our Service. When disclosing information to our Partners or otherwise selling user information for scientific or market research purposes, we make sure to anonymize and/or remove all Personal Information or other personally-identifying indicators in the data (de-identification) to minimize the possibility of accidental member identification.
  • Law enforcement, legal proceedings, and as authorized by law: We may disclose or otherwise allow access to Personal Information pursuant to a legal requirement or request, such as a subpoena, search warrant or court order, or in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Such disclosure or access may occur with or without notice to you, if we have a good faith belief that we are legally required to do so, or that disclosure is appropriate in connection with efforts to investigate, prevent, or take action regarding actual or suspected illegal activity, fraud, or other wrongdoing.
  • Protecting Rights and Safety: We may share your Personal Information with others, with or without notice to you, in cases of emergency or if we believe in good faith that this will help protect the rights, property or personal safety of our Company, any of our Users, or any members of the general public.
  • Our Staff and Affiliated Companies: We may share Personal Information internally at STW and within our family of companies, for the purposes described in this Privacy Policy. Should we undergo any change in control, including by means of merger, acquisition or purchase of substantially all of its assets, your Personal Information may be shared with the parties involved in such an event. If we believe that such change in control might materially affect your Personal Information then stored with us, we will notify you of this event and the choices you may have via e-mail and/or prominent notice on our Website or Service.
For the removal of doubt, we may share your Personal Information in additional manners, pursuant to your explicit approval, or if we are legally obligated to do so. Additionally, we may transfer, share or otherwise use non-personal information in our sole discretion and without the need for further approval.

Information regarding the Users will be maintained, processed and stored by us and our authorized affiliates and service providers in the United States, and as necessary, in a secure cloud storage, provided by our Third-Party Service Providers.
While the data protection laws in the above jurisdictions may be different than the laws of your residence or location, please know that we, our affiliates and our service providers that store or process your Personal Information on our behalf are each committed to keeping it protected and secured, pursuant to this Privacy Policy and industry standards, regardless of any lesser legal requirements that may apply in their jurisdiction.
You hereby accept the place of storage and the transfer of information as described above.

tip.string: I did plenty of research and created this solution as an amalgamation of my research. Hypertonic Saline Nasal Rinse has been studied and proved to reduce viral load in nasal passage and help in preliminary studies of Parosmia treatment when combined with nasal steroid-treatment containing Triamcinolone Acetonide (read: Comparison of the Healing Effect of Nasal Saline Irrigation with Triamcinolone Acetonide Versus Nasal Saline Irrigation alone in COVID-19 Related Olfactory Dysfunction: A Randomized Controlled Study). I did this as soon as I could following onset of my symptoms. I also started taking 1000UI Vitamin D daily because Vitamin D is a treatment for Multiple Sclerosis (which is also caused by the demyelination of neurons; the understanding being that Parosmia is demyelination of neurons in olfactory nerve/bulb in the brain). These treatments along with exercise, a healthy diet and smell therapy, I have recovered a few weeks after the onset of Parosmia.
Tissue up the nose, allows u to eat foods that usually smell bad, also u can breathe through ur nose from little gaps. Tissues smells like tissue

Hold breath to eat, there are more bad smells than tastes but if you can get through the smell, you can sometimes taste things alright. Change all hygiene products if you need it, a lot is not tolerable.

Only to stick with the foods you find edible, eat bland foods and salted/ sweet options to change it up. Don’t push yourself to string smelling foods if you have an adversion it only makes you less able to eat them and sicker, I lost two stone in a short period of time doing this

Hawaiian rolls taste good, pretzels taste good, they make odorless shampoo, milk taste fine, meat from a pig (ham, bacon) are the only edible forms of meat I have found (they don’t taste good but it’s edible), poptarts taste good, protein bars are good to eat, taking a multivitamin helps get necessary vitamins.

Just stick to the foods that you feel are tolerable, even if they’re not the healthiest but we have to eat something. Don’t push yourself to try and force a smell to return because it will only make you sick
Diary seems to calm it down, and I can eat plain cooked or airfried fish or chicken without skin and just salt and a little pepper
Keep trying different things within limited choice and try looking to adapt recipes so that dish doesn't taste bad

Smell what you're going to eat before you eat it- especially early on. If it smells off, be careful eating. Even though boiling water smells bad to me for example, pasta tastes good, so I just keep away from the pot when possible. Also take vitamins. You need them

Try new foods even with the risk of them tasting horrible you might find something that you can tolerate same thing goes with the shampoos and soaps perfumes everything try new things you might find something that works

There is a wider range of help and support out there than it first seems. Also no one knows your body as well as you do, make sure that voice is heard because unfortunately lots of women with PCOS are given big sweeping statements about their condition and not all of it is always relevant to you and body.

Do your own research on your condition, don't just listen to doctors. Read up, ask other women for help. It's not one size fits all, try different safe things, and see what works for you. I'm hoping I can find some more information myself though.

I went raw vegan for about four months I didn’t exercise regularly but I watched what I ate and I was working at the time but my cycles because regular and they weren’t heavy. So if you can try to add in at lease one raw meal and or snack a week and progress until you’re able to do it more!
Exercise!! Use good skin care and track your calories. Batch cook your meals so you find it easy to stick to dairy and sugar free.
Hot water bottles, strong painkillers, long soaks in a bath and a partners that know what you going through, talk to them and help them understand

Crystal Star Female Harmony. Birth control is a quick fix but to really help everything you have to find what’s going to regulate the hormones inside you and there are so many naturally options you have to try. It takes a longer time but it’s worth it
Stress and dietary changes had a better result for me rather than medications, however this is incredibly sensitive and a delicate balance to manage

A really good pair of tweezers. Find exercise that you enjoy doing. Don't do anything in an extreme way that will be unsustainable. 
Teach yourself that there are many different shapes that a body can be and that they are all okay. Your daughters will probably have the condition too, so be aware and help them deal with it.
Women are often diagnosed with PCOS and that's where it ends. When I was diagnosed at 18, I was not given any information or treatment options. I have just fumbled through trying to figure it out on my own. It wasn't until I wanted to have children that I discovered that there were any options. If I had been given any referral or guidance as a teenager then I could have avoided a whole lot of arkwardness and perfonal dificulty.

Consistency is key, especially in diet and exercise. Don’t withhold food. 4-6 small meals a day has helped me a lot, as has consistent, gentle exercise. I try to walk outside for 3-5 mi a day and do yoga once or twice a week.

I found that a warm room at night, comfy pillow, soft surface and incense helps me sleep better. Also only eating when I'm actually hungry regardless of how many hours between meals that is, and cutting as muvh oils out of ny food has maintained my weight

Three things, one do your research. I cannot tell you how much I’ve been able to understand just from doing my own research. It’s helped me stop some terrible treatments from happening to me. Two, find a good doctor. I went through two before I found one that would actually listen to me. You need someone who will tailor your treatment to you, not just give you some formula the “works for everyone”. That’s not a thing in PCOS. Three, be patient. This is most certainly the hardest part. Your hormones take time to come back into balance. Its a delicate and time sucking process that will be to your benefit every day. Just stick with it!
don’t be afraid to use hot/cold gel packs!! these have genuinely helped so much!!

Lavender to sleep, exercising even just walking for the pain, dieticians are amazing and will help to maintain healthy eating, weightloss psychologists to assist with minimal exercise to not over stretch it to cause cysts popping, support from family even if they dont agree EDUCATE EDUCATE EDUCATE, Support from others on forums, Mint essential oil to deal with headaches and migraines, ANTI INFLAMMATORY FOODS; shakes are the best! Tomatoes and turmeric latte; you can make them taste good! KETO, if you dont believe it fine, BUT keto is low carb and low carb diets is what you need! Insulin resistant and gaining weight in the mid section is common with PCOS so research and go from there.

Get a sensory box. It's a box that consists of 5 senses. Hear, touch, smell, see and taste. For me i have a rubiks cube and some other anti stress toys for touch. It is good at retracting the mind. For hear i have earphones. Make yourself a playlist of the songs that make you happiest. For smell get an essential oil. Preferably one that makes you feel at ease. I use a lavender oil on some tissue and i put it on my forehead and close my eyes. For see i have put some Polaroid pictures of memories I've had with friends and the good times in my life. For taste you can put in some of your favourite sweets. Go to an environment you find calming.

If you can’t find any support or you’re on a waiting list, get the ball rolling with some self help books for BPD - there are some really great ones out there. As for the CMHT, keep a paper trail of dates because they can try to catch you out on them.
Good communication, taking time to understand what’s happening, not trying to ignore what’s happening.

Don’t be embarrassed or ashamed to talk about your diagnosis, seek help, try to get some sort of organisation happening within your life. It gives you an overwhelming sense that you are in control even on the bad days

When things are overwhelming take control of your sense, only allow them to experience what you want them to experience. Light an incense stick with a comforting smell, suck a hard boiled sweet, wear headphones and select an uplifting playlist for you, find something you can do to engage your hands and eyes. And keep going until you feel calmer.

Ask for a second opinion ...you know you better than anyone.. don't accept poor psychiatric care..you have mental health problems ..that doesn't make you any less deserving of quality care. And if in doubt get a copy of your records...depending on your country, they are fairly easy to access and can be helpful if you worry about your service provider.
Using a mood dairy. Helps me find my triggers and what led up to those moments so I can put steps in. Also helps me show my family/friends/coworks what I'm feeling if I'm unable to put it in words

As part of my emotional regulation process I have tendencies of age regression. I have lots of plushies and cute things I enjoy having around my space that calm me. They are very relaxing and help me recharge.
Having a great support system and allow yourself to be uncomfortable during your process to stability. Don’t give into your spiraling thoughts

Surround yourself with positive people who will support you even on your tougher days. Also have a few tricks up your sleeve that will help you to stop focusing on the problem. Pop a piece of gum or a mint in your mouth and think about how it tastes, feels, etc. Or take a sip of cold water, splash water on your face or put a cool rag on your neck. Even just walking away from the space for a few minutes. Lastly, when all else fails, I grab my phone. I take 5 minutes to play bubble shooter or sudoku or some other game. I have also learned to allow myself to step away from the situation and revisit it later when I am calm, rational and ready. In my phone photo gallery, I created a folder with random pictures and downloaded videos that made me laugh out loud when I saw them on Facebook and TikTok, named it LOLs; another folder I named SparkHearts for things that warm my heart when I see them. There are so many things you can learn from DBT group sessions, I actually attended the local teaching hospital's program 3 times consecutively per my dr recommendation and each time, I found a new way help myself.

When overwhelming feelings arise and the need to hurt yourself is strong, accept the feeling is not going away, but make yourself very comfortable (shower, moisturise, comfortable pijamas) and prop you pillows and blankets up and put a nice movie or TV show on. I find that if all of inside me is feeling destructive and lousy, making all of my sensory surroundings comfortable helps to calm me down.

Get into DBT. Buy DBT workbooks. As much as you can, TRY to act opposite to your emotions–  not to just simply distract yourself but to prove that voice inside your head wrong. Allow yourself to feel for as long as you need to but do not react externally. Don’t dwell in your head for too long and learn to ground yourself once you’ve given yourself some time to feel your emotions. Take your medication even when you don’t want to. If you’re in therapy, keep going even when you feel like you’ve gotten better.

When I feel myself getting overwhelmed I take a deep breath, let it out slowly to regulate my breathing then I saw to my self 5 things I can see, 4 things i can hear, 3 things i can touch, 2 things i can smell and 1 thing i can taste (i always have cherry cola tic tacs in my bag). This helps settle my mind and bring the left and right sides of my brain working together so I'm back in control of my emotions.

Play video games it's a mental escape gives time for the brain to relax for a moment.  Also walking,  if the stress is to much , go to a private place ,flay your arms around  ,crunch fists if you have to do it like your extremely excited about something . for me it helps push a large amount of tense stress engery out really quickly.

Yes! Natural pills and oils help me a lot! I started with my anxiety! I have pills by my doctor and natural oils for it! Meditation, drawing, writing too! BUT MOST IMPORTANTLY:  don’t blame yourself! Don’t be too arch on yourself and pls pls pls don’t return your anger to you! Self harm never help with emotions. It’s an addiction you can’t really get out easily. See a therapist! Talk about your emotions it’s the most important thing! Stay safe
headphones, a hobby you can immerse yourself in that has instant gratification

description.string: We're all in this together to create a friendly environment. Let's treat everyone with respect. Healthy debates are natural, but kindness is required.
This is a safe space. Profanity and bullying of any kind are not allowed, and degrading comments about race, religion, culture, sexual orientation, gender, or identity will not be tolerated.
The rules of this community are crucial to maintaining a civilized and friendly space. Failure to comply with any of the above rules will result in the removal of your posts/comments with no warning.
Be mindful when writing about topics that may be triggers for other community members. Please write “Trigger Warning” at the top of such posts and leave a large space before the text.

If you are experiencing a life threatening medical emergency or fear for your safety or the safety of others, contact emergency services. Below is a list of emergency numbers in some of the countries where our community members live:

name.string: Beyond Blue: Anxiety, depression and suicide prevention support
1737, need to talk? Free call or text 1737 any time.

emergencies.string: For emergencies, call 10111 or 112 (from mobile phone)

description.string:
We want this to be a safe place for everyone to express their feelings freely. While we do not delete posts containing suicidal content, we urge you to seek professional help if you are experiencing suicidal thoughts.

There are hotlines around the world where trained staff can offer support, 24 hours a day.  Below is a list of hotlines in some of the countries where our community members live:
Content that encourages dangerous or illegal activities that risk serious physical harm or death (such as illegal hard drugs) isn't allowed.
All medical advice should come from your doctor or a healthcare professional. The information in our community is not meant as a substitute for professional medical advice of any kind.

Being part of the StuffThatWorks community requires mutual trust. Authentic, detailed and personal posts can help everyone, but many of the topics are sensitive and private. What's shared in the group should stay in the group.
Promotions, MLM (multi-level marketing), self-promotions, fundraising, and irrelevant links are not permitted.
Please do not post political, religious, controversial, or irrelevant content.

content_paragraph_1.string: Welcome! You are invited to communicate, engage and obtain certain remote care services from your medical or health care provider (“The Clinic”), the online platform applications and solution, operated by Stuff That Works Ltd. (“STW” or “Stuff That Works”). The Stuff That Works Solution allows you to share information about your health conditions and treatment and receive information regarding health conditions, and treatment experiences of other users (the “STW Solution”). Stuff That Works collaborates with your Clinic via a “STW for Clinics” feature to allow you to engage with your Clinic and receive certain remote medical and remote care services from your Clinic via the STW Solution. These remote care services may include alerts by the Clinic, a timeline providing information about past and present status of your symptoms, treatment, and side effects. Please read carefully before onboarding the services:

content_paragraph_2.string: 1. I agree to receive remote care services from my Clinic via the online Stuff that Works Solution and related mobile applications and online services.

content_paragraph_3.string: 2. I agree that my name, contact information (e.g. phone number, e-mail address etc.) and personal information including certain information regarding my medical condition, and information which I may share with the Clinic via the STW Solution, is and may be shared by the Clinic with STW, and stored by STW in its cloud-based technology, in order to allow STW to provide me with the remote care/engagement services from the Clinic via STW.

content_paragraph_4.string: 3. According to my instructions and consent I authorize Stuff that Works to share personal information I upload to the STW Solution with the Clinic to allow the Clinic to provide me with remote care services I choose to receive.

content_paragraph_5.string: 4. Stuff that Works will only use your personal information in accordance with STW Terms of Use [____] and Privacy Policy [____], which you have read and you agree to.

content_paragraph_6.string: 5. Stuff that Works, its related mobile applications and online services and the remote care services you are obtaining from your Clinic via Stuff that Works are not a replacement for usual healthcare. Rather the are complementary measures to allow communication and engagement with your Clinic and assist your Clinic to provide you with health coaching and long-term non-acute care.

content_paragraph_7.string: 6. STW does not monitor nor supervise any content uploaded, or action or lack of action, by me or by the applicable Clinics or the patients. I understand that my information is NOT being actively or continuously monitored by STW, the Clinic or any Clinic’s authorized users/healthcare providers. I will not expect timely, constant or immediate monitoring of my health or medical situation by the Clinic or by STW, STW for Clinics, Solution or related application(s) or online services.

content_paragraph_8.string: 7. NOT EMERGENCY CARE: StuffthatWorks, its related mobile applications and online services and the remote care services you are obtaining from your Clinic via StuffthatWorks are not intended as, nor a replacement for, emergency care, life- support, or other circumstanced requiring immediate clinical action. For immediate or emergency care call [Emergency Services/101/911], contract your health care provider directly, and do not use STW or any remote care online services.

content_paragraph_9.string: 8. I acknowledge and agree that STW is not a health care provider and has no responsibility whatsoever to the medical information and/or protocol, diagnosis, determination, recommendation (including any treatment recommendations and/or notifications), content or any other information provided by or on behalf the Clinic or its authorized users or otherwise conveyed to me via the STW Solution or obtained therefrom.

content_paragraph_91.string: 9. I have the right to revoke my consent to receive remote care services hereunder if I notify my Clinic and actively disconnect from the STW for Clinics feature.

content_paragraph_92.string: 10. No warranties: STW features, applications, products and services are provided “as is” without warranties of any kind, either express or implied, including without limitation warranties of fitness for a particular purpose or non-infringement. For the avoidance of doubt, STW expressly disclaims any liability with respect to the correctness, timing, compatibility or otherwise accuracy of notifications provided in connection with and/or as part of the remote patient engagement.
